name: Using-Pyspark-Gradient-Boosted Trees-Classifier-Model
description: Train and evaluate a Gradient-Boosted Trees classification model using PySpark.

nodes.name: Vector Assembler
nodes.description: Merges multiple columns into a vector column.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Input Columns
fields.description: Input column of type - all numeric, boolean and vector

fields.name: outputCol
fields.title: Output Column
fields.description: Output column name

fields.name: handleInvalid
fields.title: Handle Invalid
fields.description: How to handle invalid data (NULL values). Options are 'skip' (filter out rows with invalid data), 'error' (throw an error), or 'keep' (return relevant number of NaN in the output).

nodes.name: Split
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows(passed from lower edge id to next node) and the other containing the remaining 30%(passed from higher edge id to next node).

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Random number for Reproducibility

nodes.name: Spark Predict
nodes.description: Predict node takes in a DataFrame and Model and makes predictions

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: model_uuid
fields.title: Model UUID
fields.description: Enter the model uuid

fields.name: enablePredictionOverTimeMetrics
fields.title: Enable Prediction Over Time Metrics
fields.description: enable

fields.name: modelCategory
fields.title: Model Category
fields.description: Select the category

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

nodes.name: GBT Classifier
nodes.description: Gradient-Boosted Trees (GBTs) is a learning algorithm for classification. It supports binary labels, as well as both continuous and categorical features. Note: Multiclass labels are not currently supported.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: featuresCol
fields.title: Features Column
fields.description: Features column of type vectorUDT for model fitting

fields.name: labelCol
fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: The prediction column created during model scoring.

fields.name: impurity
fields.title: Impurity
fields.description: The Criterion used for information gain calculation

fields.name: lossType
fields.title: Loss Function
fields.description: The Loss function which GBT tries to minimize

fields.name: splitRatio
fields.title: Split Ratio
fields.description: Split Ratio

fields.name: maxBins
fields.title: Max Bins
fields.description: The maximum number of bins used for discretizing continuous features.Must be >= 2 and >= number of categories in any categorical feature.

fields.name: maxDepth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: The Maximum depth of a tree

fields.name: maxIter
fields.title: Max Iterations
fields.description: The maximum number of iterations(>=0)(a.k.a numtrees)

fields.name: minInfoGain
fields.title: Min Information Gain
fields.description: The Minimum information gain for a split to be considered at a tree node

fields.name: minInstancesPerNode
fields.title: Min Instances Per Node
fields.description: The Minimum number of instances each child must have after split

fields.name: subsamplingRate
fields.title: Subsampling Rate
fields.description: The fraction of the training data used for learning each decision tree.

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: The random seed

fields.name: stepSize
fields.title: Step Size
fields.description: Step size (a.k.a. learning rate), The step size to be used for each iteration of optimization.

fields.name: cacheNodeIds
fields.title: Cache Node Ids
fields.description: The caching nodes IDs. Can speed up training of deeper trees.

fields.name: checkpointInterval
fields.title: Checkpoint Interval
fields.description: The checkpoint interval. E.g. 10 means that the cache will get checkpointed every 10 iterations.Set checkpoint interval (>= 1) or disable checkpoint (-1)

fields.name: maxMemoryInMB
fields.title: Max memory
fields.description: Maximum memory in MB allocated to histogram aggregation.

fields.name: validationIndicatorCol
fields.title: Validation Indicator Column
fields.description: Param for name of the column that indicates whether each row is for training or for validation.

fields.name: featureSubsetStrategy
fields.title: Feature Subset Strategy
fields.description: The number of features to consider for splits at each tree node

fields.name: minWeightFractionPerNode
fields.title: Min Weight Fraction per Node
fields.description: Minimum fraction of the weighted sample count that each child must have after split.

fields.name: weightCol
fields.title: Weight Column
fields.description: Param for weight column name. If this is not set or empty, we treat all instance weights as 1.0.

fields.name: minInfoGainGrid
fields.title: Min Information Gain Param Grid Search
fields.description: Min Information Gain Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxBinsGrid
fields.title: Max Bins Param Grid Search
fields.description: Max Bins Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxDepthGrid
fields.title: Max Depth Param Grid Search
fields.description: Max Depth Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxIterGrid
fields.title: Max Iteration Param Grid Search
fields.description: Max Iteration Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName

fields.name: encoding

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
How to Use with Your Data

  • Replace diabetes.csv with your own dataset.
  • Ensure your dataset columns match the model's expected Feature Columns.
  • Set the correct Label Column and adjust parameters (e.g., max iterations, max depth) as needed.
  • Use evaluation outputs (e.g., accuracy, confusion matrix) to assess model performance.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow

nodes.name: Sticky Note
nodes.description: Allows capturing Notes on the Workflow

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Bg Color
fields.description: Background of note

fields.name: width
fields.title: Width
fields.description: Width of note

fields.name: height
fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Execution Flow

  1. CSV Input - Load your dataset (e.g., diabetes.csv).
  2. Vector Assembler - Prepare and assemble feature vectors.
  3. Split - Divide dataset into training and testing sets.
  4. GBT Classifier - Train a Gradient-Boosted Trees model.
  5. Spark Predict - Apply the trained model to the dataset.
  6. Print N Rows - Display a preview of predictions and input data.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Overview

This workflow demonstrates how to train and evaluate a Gradient-Boosted Trees (GBT) classification model using PySpark. It provides a reusable template that can be adapted for any dataset by changing the input file and adjusting configurations. GBT is effective for classification tasks, offering a powerful ensemble learning model.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow
